title: Arsenal 'target Wolves centre-back Willy Boly' with Unai Emery desperate to improve defence
text:
Arsenal are reportedly showing interest in Wolves defender Willy Boly after an impressive run of form.

Unai Emery is still on the look out for defensive reinforcements after signing David Luiz and Kieran Tierney in the summer and the Wolves man may fit the bill, according to the Sun.

Boly, 28, joined Wolves in 2017 and won promotion to the Premier League in his first season at Molineux.

Arsenal are reportedly tracking Wolves ace Willy Boly as they seek defensive reinforcements

Wolves are reluctant to sell the the centre back but could make a decent profit on the £10million paid to Porto for the Frenchman's signature.

The defender scored a late winner in midweek in Wolves' 1-0 win over Besiktas in the UEFA Europa League and has been one of the club's best performers this season.

Arsenal's problems in defence are no secret with 11 goals conceded in their seven Premier League matches so far.

Summer signing David Luiz has failed to impress since joining from Chelsea on deadline day and Sokratis does not seem a long-term solution for the Gunners.

Calum Chambers and Rob Holding are returning to full fitness after lengthy injuries, however, the north London club are still in need of strong defensive options.
description: Arsenal are interested in Wolves centre-back Willy Boly with David Luiz failing to impress since joining on deadline day. The 28-year-old has impressed so far this season in his third term at Molineux.
